alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Monterey; San Benito; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 12:53PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Moderate to heavy showers are impacting portions of South Bay, Santa Cruz, northern San Benito & Monterey counties. Many reports of roadway flooding along with rocks or mud reported on a few roads. Please use caution while driving this afternoon and evening as showers continue. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz counties along with the northern portions of San Benito and Monterey counties, including the Monterey Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1249 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Fremont, Salinas, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Mountain View, Milpitas, Palo Alto, Santa Cruz, Cupertino, Watsonville, Gilroy, Newark, Campbell, Morgan Hill, Hollister, Seaside, Menlo Park, Saratoga and Los Gatos. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Monterey; San Benito; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
